# Class Schedule

### STAT 184: Introduction to R
This course will introduce students to data computing fundamentals and a reproducible workflow using the R programming language and related tools.

### STAT 414: Intro to Prob Theory
This course is an introduction to the theory of probability for students in statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, and related fields. The course presents students with calculus-based probability concepts and those concepts can be used to describe the uncertainties present in real applications.

[here is the link for this class](https://bulletins.psu.edu/university-course-descriptions/undergraduate/stat/)

### SOC 119N: Race,Ethnicity and Culture
This course focuses on historical patterns and current status of racial, ethnic and cultural groups and issues locally, nationally, and internationally.Students will be able to more clearly explain how their identity reflects and shapes their life experiences as well as others in their racial and ethnic group.

[here is the link for this class](https://bulletins.psu.edu/university-course-descriptions/undergraduate/soc/)
